docs.text: MkDocs-Nature § A MkDocs Theme. A clone of the "greenish" Sphinx theme of the same name. Installation § To install the MkDocs-Nature them, run the following command: pip install mkdocs-nature Setup § Configure your MkDocs project to use the theme by setting the theme.name to nature : theme : name : nature For a list of supported variables which can be set in the config, see the documented features . Documentation § Features About Contributing Release Notes
docs.title: MkDocs-Nature

docs.text: About MkDocs-Nature § Copyright § The original Sphinx theme ("nature") and its parts used here are copyright © 2007-2016 by the Sphinx team (see AUTHORS ). The MkDocs templates, as well as additions and tweaks to the Sphinx theme are copyright © 2017 by Waylan Limberg. License § The original Sphinx theme ("nature") and its parts used here are licensed under a BSD License . The MkDocs templates, as well as additions and tweaks to the Sphinx theme are licensed under a BSD License .
docs.title: The Project

docs.title: Copyright

docs.title: License

docs.text: Contributing to MkDocs-Nature § An introduction to contributing to the MkDocs-Nature Theme. Contributions from developers and users are welcome. Contributions can be made in a number of ways, including: Code patches via pull requests Documentation improvements Bug reports and patch reviews Resources § When contributing to the project, the following resources will likely be helpful to you: Source Code Issue Tracker MkDocs Documentation Jinja Documentation Source of parent Sphinx theme . Code of Conduct § Everyone interacting with the project's codebases, issue trackers, etc. is expected to follow the PyPA Code of Conduct . Reporting an Issue § When reporting an issue, please include as much detail as you can, including your platform, MkDocs version, theme version and relevent config settings. If the problem is visual please include a screenshot and if you get an error please include the full error and traceback.
docs.title: Contributing

docs.text: Features § The MkDocs-Nature theme supports a number of features which are configurable by the end user. Theme Variables Search Code Highlighting Theme Variables § The theme includes support for a few variables which can be set by the user to control the theme's behavior. theme.icon § Point this setting at an image file in your docs_dir to display an icon in your documentation. theme : name : nature icon : icon.png theme.logo § Point this setting at an image file in your docs_dir to display logo in your documentation. theme : name : nature logo : logo.png theme.release § Use this setting to include the version of the project you are documenting in your documentation. theme : name : nature release : '2.1.3' theme.issue_tracker § Assign the URL for your issue tracker to this setting to include a "Report a Bug" link on each page. For example, if you use GitHub to track issues: theme : name : nature issue_tracker : https://github.com/user/project/issues repo_url § Assign the URL for your repository to this setting to include a link on each page. See MkDocs' documentation for more details. edit_uri § When set, an "edit this page" link is included on each page. Note that if the repo_url points to either GitHub or Bitbucket, this setting is automatically configured and does not need to be set manually. See MkDocs' documentation for more details. copyright § Assign the text to be used as a copyright notice in the footer of each page. For example: copyright : "Copyright © 2017" site_author § Assign the name to be included with the copyright notice on each page. This setting is ignored if copyright is not also set. Search § The MkDocs-Nature theme includes support for MkDocs search plugin. As long as the search plugin is enabled (MkDocs' default), a search page will be generated and included in your site. If you would like to disable search, then disable the search plugin by defining a plugins setting which does not include search . If you have no other plugins, then set plugins to an empty list: plugins : [] Permalinks § To enable permalinks to appear when hovering over any page or section headers, you need to enable the relevant configuration setting for the TOC extension of Python-Markdown. markdown_extensions : - toc : permalink : true By default, the pilcrow or paragraph sign (¶) is used for the permalink. If you would like different text, set permalink to your desired string instead of true . For example setting it to § would display the section sign. Admonitions § The appropriate CSS styles are defined to support the admonition extension to Python-Markdown. To utilize admonitions, enable the extension in your config file: markdown_extensions : - admonition Attention See the Admonition Extension documentation for specifics on the syntax. Code Highlighting § By enabling the codehilite extension in your mkdocs.yml config file you get syntax highlighting support using Pygments' Tango theme. Configuration § Enable the codehilite extension in your mkdocs.yml config file: markdown_extensions : - codehilite Usage § For best results, be sure to identify the language of each code block in your Markdown files. JavaScript Sample § For example, by using the following Markdown: ```javascript alert("A JavaScript Alert!"); ``` Your codeblock will render as: alert ( "A JavaScript Alert!" ); HTML Sample § <!DOCTYPE html> < html lang = "en" > < head > < meta http-equiv = "Content-Type" content = "text/html; charset=utf-8" /> < title > Hello, World! </ title > </ head > < body > < h1 > Hello, World! </ h1 > </ body > </ html > Python Sample § >>> def hello ( name ): ... print u "Hello, {} !" . format ( name ) ... >>> hello ( 'World' ) u 'Hello, World!'
docs.title: Features

docs.text: The MkDocs-Nature theme supports a number of features which are configurable by the end user. Theme Variables Search Code Highlighting
docs.title: Features

docs.text: The theme includes support for a few variables which can be set by the user to control the theme's behavior.
docs.title: Theme Variables

docs.text: Point this setting at an image file in your docs_dir to display an icon in your documentation. theme : name : nature icon : icon.png
docs.title: theme.icon

docs.text: Point this setting at an image file in your docs_dir to display logo in your documentation. theme : name : nature logo : logo.png
docs.title: theme.logo

docs.text: Use this setting to include the version of the project you are documenting in your documentation. theme : name : nature release : '2.1.3'
docs.title: theme.release

docs.text: Assign the URL for your issue tracker to this setting to include a "Report a Bug" link on each page. For example, if you use GitHub to track issues: theme : name : nature issue_tracker : https://github.com/user/project/issues
docs.title: theme.issue_tracker

docs.text: Assign the URL for your repository to this setting to include a link on each page. See MkDocs' documentation for more details.
docs.title: repo_url

docs.text: When set, an "edit this page" link is included on each page. Note that if the repo_url points to either GitHub or Bitbucket, this setting is automatically configured and does not need to be set manually. See MkDocs' documentation for more details.
docs.title: edit_uri

docs.text: Assign the text to be used as a copyright notice in the footer of each page. For example: copyright : "Copyright © 2017"
docs.title: copyright

docs.text: Assign the name to be included with the copyright notice on each page. This setting is ignored if copyright is not also set.
docs.title: site_author

docs.text: The MkDocs-Nature theme includes support for MkDocs search plugin. As long as the search plugin is enabled (MkDocs' default), a search page will be generated and included in your site. If you would like to disable search, then disable the search plugin by defining a plugins setting which does not include search . If you have no other plugins, then set plugins to an empty list: plugins : []
docs.title: Search

docs.text: To enable permalinks to appear when hovering over any page or section headers, you need to enable the relevant configuration setting for the TOC extension of Python-Markdown. markdown_extensions : - toc : permalink : true By default, the pilcrow or paragraph sign (¶) is used for the permalink. If you would like different text, set permalink to your desired string instead of true . For example setting it to § would display the section sign.
docs.title: Permalinks

docs.text: The appropriate CSS styles are defined to support the admonition extension to Python-Markdown. To utilize admonitions, enable the extension in your config file: markdown_extensions : - admonition Attention See the Admonition Extension documentation for specifics on the syntax.
docs.title: Admonitions

docs.text: By enabling the codehilite extension in your mkdocs.yml config file you get syntax highlighting support using Pygments' Tango theme.
docs.title: Code Highlighting

docs.text: Enable the codehilite extension in your mkdocs.yml config file: markdown_extensions : - codehilite
docs.title: Configuration

docs.text: For best results, be sure to identify the language of each code block in your Markdown files.
docs.title: Usage

docs.text: For example, by using the following Markdown: ```javascript alert("A JavaScript Alert!"); ``` Your codeblock will render as: alert ( "A JavaScript Alert!" );
docs.title: JavaScript Sample

docs.text: <!DOCTYPE html> < html lang = "en" > < head > < meta http-equiv = "Content-Type" content = "text/html; charset=utf-8" /> < title > Hello, World! </ title > </ head > < body > < h1 > Hello, World! </ h1 > </ body > </ html >
docs.title: HTML Sample

docs.text: >>> def hello ( name ): ... print u "Hello, {} !" . format ( name ) ... >>> hello ( 'World' ) u 'Hello, World!'
docs.title: Python Sample

docs.text: Release Notes § Version 0.4 (2020/04/09) § Account for code tags in codehilite output. Version 0.3.1 (2018/08/03) § Fix typo in base.html template. Version 0.3 (2018/08/03) § Update for MkDocs version 1.0. Ensure tables styles get applied to Markdown tables. Version 0.2.1 (2017/12/01) § Include *.yml files in MANIFEST.in. Version 0.2 (2017/11/30) § Document installation and setup. Add wheel support. Add 404 error page. Add site_url to config. Version 0.1 (2017/11/30) § The initial release.
docs.title: Release Notes
